participant_1.background:
I am allergic to dogs.
I am colorblind.
I went into the army after high school.
I like to sing karok.

participant_2.background:
I want to be a doctor when i grow up.
I drive a volkswagen beetle.
I am going to auburn university next year as a freshman.
I am 17 years old and a senior in high school.

content.text: Hey Bard, what do you want to talk about?
I'd like to talk about your experience in the Army.
Sure, what would you like to know?
What was it like being colorblind in the Army?

It was definitely a challenge, but I was able to overcome it. I had to learn how to work around my colorblindness, and I did a lot of training to make sure that I could still do my job safely and effectively.
That's impressive. What was your job in the Army?
I was a medic, so I was responsible for providing medical care to soldiers in the field.
That must have been a lot of pressure.
It was, but it was also very rewarding. I was able to help a lot of people, and I made some great friends along the way.
What did you do after the Army?
I went to college and got a degree in nursing. I'm now a nurse practitioner, and I love my job.
That's great! I'm glad you found a career that you're passionate about.
Me too. I'm really happy with my life.
That's good to hear. Do you have any plans for the future?
I'm not sure yet. I'm just enjoying my time as a nurse practitioner for now.
Well, I'm sure you'll figure it out. You seem like a smart and capable person.
